originalText.text: Very poor job is hemming my sleeves and re-attachment of my cuffs to the sleeves. Echoing a previous review of terrible workmanship (because it was deemed too cheap of a job to matter), extremely rude tailor (the old, short, chubby man who does the work/takes the measurements). To expect even hems was apparently asking for ‘perfection’. In addition, he created a hole/tear on my brand new jacket. I have never left a review but felt compelled to. I  believe if we were w h i t e, we wouldn’t have been treated with such contempt despite being calm and non aggressive (he was very defensive and wanted to blame the manufacturer for his lack of measuring properly the sleeves which were uneven and fixed elsewhere after confirming our suspicions).

originalText.text: Been going here for 6 years and have received great tailoring every single time on dozens of pieces. You can tell they have a good heart.  Honest people that will walk you through how they’ll tailor your garment and charge a very reasonable price (cash only).  Originally found them when I lived in East village but now live in UES and keep making the trip down. Great people that really care about their customers.

originalText.text: A poor experience. We went today 11/20/23 to pick up a jacket to shorten the arms. When she went to try it on, we noticed a disparity with uneven sleeves. He gaslit and said it wasn’t him and that it was because her arms were uneven or manufacturer fault. He said he didn’t have the time to care for a $25 job and that we shouldn’t be looking for perfection and if so, to do it ourselves or go elsewhere. So if there wasn’t a problem with his alterations, why did he admit it wasn’t done ‘perfectly’? Excuse us for wanting something done properly. To further prove that it was his work and not us (or her arms being two different lengths), we went to the tailor shop opposite who confirmed our suspicions. Don’t go there if you want to deal with indignity and if your job is deemed unworthy by them (it was a lululemon jacket). Here’s proof of the disparity in length taken at the other tailors.

originalText.text: I went to another tailor that turned my backpack repair down and advised me to go to a shoe repair ... instead I went to another tailor, The Tailoring Room, who effectively made the repair on the spot for a reasonable price. My backpack has held up beautifully even after frequent use post-repair. Hooray!

originalText.text: I've been going to the Tailoring Room for 3 years and counting. As a little person, I need most of my clothing tailored (my suits, shirts, pants, swim trunks, jackets etc) and there's no one I trust more than Ms. Andrea, Mr. Frankie and their amazing team of tailors to get me RIGHT. They're the best at what they do, they make sure I walk out of their shop with PERFECTLY fitting garments, and on top of all that, they're really sweet people. They're the best in the city hands down! Grateful for their services and grateful for their friendship too!
